item.title: Ticket #1297 (HTML entities appear in RSS/RDF descrptions) closed
item.dc:creator: ryan

item.title: Ticket #1297 (HTML entities appear in RSS/RDF descrptions) updated
item.dc:creator: nimbustier

item.title: Ticket #1297 (HTML entities appear in RSS/RDF descrptions) created
item.dc:creator: nimbustier
item.description:
When the user enters HTML named entities in the body of his post, they are transmitted as-is in the RSS and RDF descriptions. While numeric entities are valid in any XML format, named entities are bound to a DTD, and make the RSS / RDF feeds broken, at least in some agregators. (see a "bug report" along these lines: ​http://wordpress.org/support/topic.php?id=19421)

Wordpress should make sure not to output named entities in this context.

item.title: Ticket #1296 (New registered users have 'not-deletable' http:/// URL als Homepage) updated
item.dc:creator: Syn

item.title: Ticket #1296 (New registered users have 'not-deletable' http:/// URL als Homepage) created
item.dc:creator: Syn
item.description:
Strange thing. Registered users with no homepage specified are shown as they have a homepage linked to ​http:/// This is wierd, i created a testuser, he had this URL too, i deleted the URL at the Admin Panel, saved and ​http:// was back again, not deletably. I tried another user, same process, ​http:/// while registering but i COULD delete it at the Admin CP and it was erased. Sometimes it works and sometimes it doesn't.

Only one Plugin is working: Mail Obfuscator (​http://www.blackbirdblog.it/programmazione/progetti/25)

item.title: Ticket #1295 (Customize sort order of posts in a category) updated
item.dc:creator: keikenti

item.title: Ticket #1295 (Customize sort order of posts in a category) created
item.dc:creator: keikenti
item.description:
Two additional field in the Manage Categories administration tab to customize the sort order and sort key for a given category would be very helpful.

For instance, sorting the posts by the posts date or name in Ascending order instead of Descending.

item.title: Ticket #1294 (Time zone display) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Ok now that has changed for some reason. now at GMT -6 it sshows the right time for mst but says EDT

item.title: Ticket #1294 (Time zone display) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: I want the time display to show the time zone on the posts. But when I use the T in dashboard options Default time format: it displays GMT not GMT -5 or MST which is what it actually is on my blog.

item.title: Ticket #1293 (XFN checkbox and radio, on link-manager, are never treated) updated
item.dc:creator: Flegme

item.title: Ticket #1293 (XFN checkbox and radio, on link-manager, are never treated) created
item.dc:creator: Flegme
item.description: the informations in radios and checkboxs are never treated in the Link Relationship (XFN) part. the only thing that the case 'Add' and 'editlink' treat is the field 'rel'.
